channel.title: Messing around with OpenGL/C++
channel.description:
been messing with this stuff in my free time. using md2 model format for animation and all. its all kinda neat and fun to use imo.
[img]https://i.gyazo.com/6e7b84f9f54f5755cdc68e7ef1d33ec3.gif[/img]

item.title: Messing around with OpenGL/C++
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“317guy, post:6, topic:553348”][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=672264.msg4496158#msg4496158 date=1443055385]
Definitely there’s another one also here:

http://www.mbsoftworks.sk/index.php?page=tutorials&series=1

This code is a little harder to understand atleast for me cuz I’m a beginner with c++ but I’m working on the textured terrain stuff atm definitely a bit confusing. But good tutorials all around
[/quote]
Thanks! I use DirectX But i don’t like the window’s only factor, And With OpenGL you can use Emscripten and port your games too the Web for all platforms but Give it 4-5 month’s C++ will be a lot easier, Just keep practicing and don’t give up![/quote]

It’s annoying I think I need to pause and work on some small programs and make them work then jump into this stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Messing around with OpenGL/C++
item.dc:creator: @317guy 317guy
item.description:
@317guy wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:5, topic:553348”]Definitely there’s another one also here:

http://www.mbsoftworks.sk/index.php?page=tutorials&series=1

This code is a little harder to understand atleast for me cuz I’m a beginner with c++ but I’m working on the textured terrain stuff atm definitely a bit confusing. But good tutorials all around[/quote]
Thanks! I use DirectX But i don’t like the window’s only factor, And With OpenGL you can use Emscripten and port your games too the Web for all platforms but Give it 4-5 month’s C++ will be a lot easier, Just keep practicing and don’t give up!

Read full topic
